name: FDA
title: Combined CAIO + Head of IT

classification.classificationRationale: Minimal data. CAIO combined with Head of IT suggests AI governance is merged with IT infrastructure — a common government pattern. Contrasts with Mechanism #9 (Hire CAIOs from Consumer Tech): Walsh comes from IT/federal contracting, not consumer tech. Low confidence due to single source.

description: The FDA hired Jeremy Walsh as its first Chief AI Officer AND Head of IT — a combined role that places AI governance directly within the IT function. Walsh comes from an IT professional background with federal health agency contracting experience. This contrasts with the emerging pattern of hiring CAIOs from consumer tech or data science backgrounds (Mechanism #9), suggesting federal agencies may follow a different pipeline where IT operations experience is valued over AI research or product expertise.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: CAIO combined with Head of IT — single role.

mechanisms.name: Log Everything When Regulators Watch
mechanisms.evidence: FDA is itself the regulator — AI deployment in a regulatory agency inherently requires maximum auditability and compliance.

taxonomyFeedback: The combined CAIO + Head of IT role is a distinct pattern in government orgs — merging AI leadership with IT infrastructure. May indicate that government agencies see AI as an IT upgrade rather than a strategic transformation.
Contrasts sharply with Mechanism #9 (Hire CAIOs from Consumer Tech) — federal agencies hiring from IT/contracting pipelines.
